response.message: I think you misspelled "hawt" at the end there.
Congratulations!
A well-deserved congratulations, and glad to have been part of the journey since the beginning! With love from an early user, http://stackexchange.com/users/9 :-D

Got a typo on the hott new "about" page - it reads Andreesen Horowitz rather than Andreessen Horowitz. The new investors won't be pleased :P
Fixed, thanks. --Ed.
Congrats to the team -- this is quite a milestone!  Keep pushing!

Congrats! Typo report: *They makes us very proud*.
Fixed, thanks. --Ed.
Congrats SO!! Proud to be a minor part in your journey!!

How do you know when your audience is mainly developers? They insist on helping you fix all of your bugs :P

Thanks for pursuing this and making an amazing resource. I have personally benefited from this and learn new things every day!

You never got back to the gold plated chairs and... where's my lox platter again?!

Congrats!

Joining team copy editor: On the new "About" page, first item of the company timeline: "Jeff Atwood, also well-known for this popular Coding Horror blog..." looks and feels as though it should read "his" blog, not "this" blog.
Fixed, thanks! --Ed.
Love the imagery with the old maps analogy!

You had me chuckling at "Behold!.." and again a few times after. 

Waiting and hoping to see GD SE get a shout out in one of these awesome blog posts. :)
Stackoverflow is a good place to help people :). Good luck adding new stuff and keeping stackoverflow great! :)
congrats, you guys rocks !

U.S. and U.K. media  contact phone numbers are symmetrically placed on the page. But only one of two has country code. Odd.

Also odd: U.S. media contact offers "press release" (link to blog), while U.K. offers "download logos". The tabular format strongly associates these buttons with individual contacts, which makes no sense.  

The sentence ending with "...remote workers from Israel, Brazil, Japan, Germany, Slovenia, France, and other parts of the United States" needs a geographical reality check.
An investment of over $8 per member. Is it me or is that huge!? Congratulations!

Gold plated chairs?   Come on that's so tacky.

It's platinum baby!
You appear to have created a crowd sourced spell checker too. Amazing. :)

Surely some of that money is going towards gold-plating the doorknobs as well? :)

Thanks Andreessen, and congratulations!

Congratulations! 
Thanks for making Internet a better place.

Why not come to poker.stackexhange.com & use some of the excess cash for game or two! Could end up with *more* than $40 million!;D 

p.s. Congrats. Well deserved.

That's a lot of money for one company. Can I take care of most of it? Thanks!

jk, that's really awesome. Someone has to have a lot of faith to just donate that much (unless he's a billionaire). Use it wisely like you are planning to!

Congratulations!

It seems comments without snarky remarks, spell or proof checks are deleted:

Why the About page has Pageviews: 6.4B and not 6.4G ?
This is  well deserved, Congratulations! I believe StackOverflow is on its way to becoming as big (and helpful) as Wikipedia!

I hope the ruthless lawyers turned their ruthlessness to 11. 

I don't want to see Stackexchange pivot into Facebook for professionals or worse...

@Matthias

There's no chance of us becoming a 'faceless' greedy company that was once pure and then corrupted by so many unicorn dollars. Nothing changes except that we now have room to do more than we did before; our autonomy isn't for sale. We'll continue pushing ahead exactly on the path that Joel described, just .. faster :)

Congratulations to the entire StackOverflow family. This community has helped countless programmers, startups and businesses. Glad to see you guys being rewarded finally.

Cheers from the Medbirdie team!

Congratulations StackExchange !!

you are truly an inspiration !

"Bye Felicia"

I had to Google search; TIL about Jared. <3 I can't imagine the amazing culture you have at the SE offices.
So... What about the gold-plated Aeron chairs, upgraded game room, and lox platters that you said you will elaborate? :P

This is great news for the SE communities and for this great collaborative endeavor to generate free content for the benefit of everyone! As for the post itself, I have mixed feelings. Simply put, I found the Jerusalem metaphor surprising, considering its international status and contemporary history/world events. I can't understand that choice or its meaning in such a context; the Middle-Ages history period link doesn't further my comprehension. I apologize for having to voice that out amidst such positive remarks. On the other hand I share in the excitement of securing this investment; well done!
Ask about it on History Stack Exchange! --Ed.
How do you put liquid oxygen on a platter?
Congratulations, well deserved and keep up the great focus! Perhaps this will offer the opportunity to find the zeitgeist of the more perfect social experience for all participation levels.
Congratulations. But Careers is still broken. Suggestions are really bad, neither match my favorite tags nor my location . No way to manage companies, vote on suggestions etc.
@Richie This kind of lox: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lox (though I half suspect you knew that already and were just trying to be cheeky :-P)
When should I expect to receive my lox platter?

Congratulations!

Does that mean, that further works on the internationalization will run like crazy?

Got my current job through Careers! Will be glad to see it improve further.

Honestly the only recruitment site it has ever been worth my time just having a casual profile on.

And SO Careers sent us a lovely gift basket at Christmas!
Congratulations!
so when can I expect my Lox and bagels?
And how would they earn that money back?

Where's the button to upvote the comment that this is great news, but choosing Jerusalem as the metaphor for StackOverflow is worrying... 

Are you saying that the new investment means you plan to turn into a venue for the Final Holy War between the vi and emacs fanatics, while the other 99% of the population waste time heckling that they both suck? :-)

P.S. What is with the captcha settings? I've been through 10 so far and still cannot read any of them!!

Good read and glad the network is going places. Unfortunately however when I read:

"The answers that we needed were hidden behind paywalls, or buried in thousands of pages of stale forums"

I now read that as:

"Some of the answers that we needed were hidden in other languages, spread across a plethora of sites"
Wow, thanks, this is the first time I read that I am not the only one who is distracted and annoyed by animated ads. I hope you do not intend to change the no-animation policy for ads.

As a side note I don't care about animated ads, they all blur into the same thing for me...ads. I ignore them all the same.

In fact due to usage on almost every other site it actually distracts me that SE does not use them since they are out of the ordinary.

Woohow, Congratulations!

Please stay obsessed until the end, you're not alone, neither are we :)

This is wonderful news!  StackExchange is one of the best, increasingly few examples of collaborative knowledge web sites with enduring value.  You've remained true to your original objectives, er, the vision thing ;o)

Question time: Post said "Today Stack Exchange is pleased to announce that we have raised $40 million, mostly from Andreessen Horowitz." Mostly? Might you be able to mention the other(s)?  Not a big deal if not!

I, for one, do like the medieval Jerusalem analogy, a lot! This isn't quite right though, "Please imagine Gregorian chamber music." Gregorian chants pre-dated chamber music by a long time. Also, it was "sacred" at the time while chamber music was (and remains) for entertainment purposes only, "profane". Sorry, picky picky, but this is the Internet and SE, where lux et veritas rules!  Again, congratulations on the new funding.
Congrats.  The sites are an excellent resource that has aided so many developers.  I am sure with these additional resources it will get better and more useful.
Excellent news for all the soft devs around the world

@Jphn: It's really hard to grasp the outsized importance Jerusalem had on people in the Middle Ages. (Though, Barbara W. Tuchman's Bible and Sword would be a good place to start.) Contemporary strife over Jerusalem exists precisely because it was so important to so many people for so long. The ideal of Jerusalem (rarely, if ever, achieved) is a place of unity and peace. Perhaps the metaphor programmer Rome or programmer New York would work better for you?
Great job guys!
Congrats ! hope stackexchange could add more features in future (like video post or livestream).Very enjoy my time in here.thank you Stackexchange.

While Careers.SO is a great resource for dev jobs, there is a distinct lack of "other" *good* types of tech (sysadmin, devops, dba, consulting, etc) postings thereon.

I think *that* is where C.SO can best improve.

"...because it would be disrespectful to programmers to strain their delicate eyes with a dancing monkey..."

And yet I have distracting questions about fucking Hobbits. #KillHotNetworkQuestions

Massive thank you. You totally wiped the floor with the competition and delivered one of the most awesome internet inventions that actually works incredibly well. My favourites and most used are Drupal, Wordpress, StackOverflow, Bicycles, Travel, Video, Photography, UX, Graphic Design, Finance, Writers. 
Cheers!
Make sure my lox is kosher please!

I remember in the early days scrolling the expert-exchange pages all the way down fighting with ads and then finding out that the right answer was covered by a banner asking for cash.

Stay awesome Stack Overflow, Thanks
Been here since the beginning. Congratulations :)
Since the community helped build stackoverflow, do we too get a piece of the pie?
StackOverflow is sure great. Careers.stackoverflow.com - meah. Indeed.com and dice.com have much better job positions advertised.
Congratulations.
Thanks a lot for SO and hearty Congratulations.
congratulations
Grats guys, you so deserve this!  Can't wait to see what happens next.

congratulations keep up the great job
you made internet a better place than it was without you
I want a raise ;)
Maybe now you will have some money to create an app for Windows Phone / Windows. ;)

@kpolo I think the aim is to make SOC a much better place than Dice for looking for programming work.

@Vitor I'd love to see one of those! I have a Windows 8 tablet that I'd love to browse Stack Overflow questions on. :-D
You should totally send me a 3xl stack overflow tshirt that I have been jonesing for since like 2010.
There goes the neighborhood… ;)
Just awsome..I hv been using SO since much time..hv always been stumbled by the quality of the responses..Kudos and keep it up.:)

You people are awesome !!
That it !!

Question on Quora:

"What is the biggest nightmare for a programmer"?
Ans:"stackoverflow is down"

I find it really interesting that you keep on argumenting about how good the service to programmers is etc. and that it will not be corrupted by "the big money".
In the end this is really nice marketing and it will pay off after all. Because a great and enduring service like stackexchange will result in big numbers, one day or the other _and_ you will still be able to deliver a great benefit to the community.
So, keep on, congrats!
Congratullations!
Gold-plating the chairs is not a bad idea - you can count that as an asset in the company's portfolio and if times get bad, you can always sell of some of a chair or two to raise cash.

Developers dont "Google" we stackoverflow.

Congrats and Keep up the good work!
Are you planning to spend any of that money on tact lessons for your moderators?

Smart investment by Andreesen-Horowitz for this for this blue ocean information exchange. The SO family of websites has the potential to become the Google of human-answered questions. Finally, at the risk of getting flamed a little, many of us -- especially those who lived through the dot-com bust -- know how important it is to eventually make money. I personally wouldn't mind relevant text-based ads for tools, targeted consulting services, or websites that show photos of puppies. Relevant ads that help us finish our work wouldn't distract and may even add value.
congrats
Congrats.Stack overflow is like God for all developers.

Congratulation as every one knows that stack overflow always provides the great opportunity for the beginners as well as for developers team mainly focus on the investing the money on useful things to create the big inventions for the future.

Again Congrats & give it up with the same way.
Grats guys, you so deserve this! Can’t wait to see what happens next.
